item.title: Markdown Sink Test
item.author: Cedric
item.description: Exhaustive test of markdown features: headings, images, code, tables, lists, footnotes, etc.

item.title: Scavenger Malware Distributed via num2words PyPI Supply Chain Compromise
item.author: invokere
item.description: A brief report on the num2words PyPI supply-chain compromise that distributed Scavenger malware. It details how a malicious update (v0.5.15 and v0.5.16) injected Windows DLL-loading code into __init__.py, executing the Scavenger Loader which connects to new C2 servers, steals .pypirc credentials, and downloads stealer modules. Includes IoCs, C2 info, and credits to researchers who discovered and analyzed the breach.

item.title: Install Linters, Get Malware - DevSecOps Speedrun Edition
item.author: humpty/tony, invokere
item.description: How Scavenger rode a compromised npm eslint-config-prettier: loader/stealer internals, anti-analysis + XXTEA C2, Chromium targeting, BeamNG ties, and actionable IOCs (with InvokeRE)

item.title: Supper is served
item.author: humpty/tony
item.description: A deep dive into Supper (Interlock RAT) a fileless Windows backdoor linked to Vice Society clarifying public report errors and detailing its C2 protocol, encryption, self-deletion, and reverse shell behavior.

item.title: Analyzing the RedTiger Malware Stealer
item.author: humpty/tony
item.description: Analysis of RedTiger, a python based stealer that leverages Discord to exfiltrate credentials
